sentence.Network_en: They have loyally supported their party and their leader.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们忠诚地拥护他们的政党和领袖。

sentence.Network_en: She has loyally and unselfishly spent every day at her husband's side.
sentence.Network_cn: 她每天都忠诚、无私地陪在她丈夫身边。

sentence.Network_en: We will loyally uphold the principles of the United Nations.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们将忠实地维护联合国的原则.

entry.tran: 忠诚的；忠心的；忠贞不渝的
entry.def: Someone who is loyal remains firm in their friendship or support for a person or thing.

example.ex: They had remained loyal to the president...
example.tran: 他们始终对总统忠心耿耿。

example.ex: He'd always been such a loyal friend to us all.
example.tran: 他一直是我们大家忠实的朋友。

means.word_mean: 1. with loyalty; in a loyal manner;

sentences.sentence: "government will not be efficient unless the people as a whole accept leadership loyally and enthusiastically"

auth_sentence.content: High temperature, Hanwell said, loyally, looking away.
auth_sentence.res_content: High temperature, Hanwell said, loyally, looking away.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: High temperature, Hanwell said, loyally, looking away.

auth_sentence.content: I served British forces honestly and loyally, and this waiting feels like a kind of punishment.
auth_sentence.res_content: I served British forces honestly and loyally, and this waiting feels like a kind of punishment.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I served British forces honestly and loyally, and this waiting feels like a kind of punishment.

auth_sentence.content: She turned instead to Howe, who was to serve her loyally in and out of government in economic and foreign policy.
auth_sentence.res_content: She turned instead to Howe, who was to serve her loyally in and out of government in economic and foreign policy.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: She turned instead to Howe, who was to serve her loyally in and out of government in economic and foreign policy.
